thread.title: Chicago Film Fest pick of the day: 'Sherlock Holmes'
thread.title_full: Chicago Film Fest pick of the day: 'Sherlock Holmes'

title: Chicago Film Fest pick of the day: 'Sherlock Holmes'
text:
Chicago Film Fest pick of the day: 'Sherlock Holmes' William Gillette 
William Gillette's played Sherlock Holmes only once, in a film that was recently restored. 
William Gillette's played Sherlock Holmes only once, in a film that was recently restored. "Sherlock Holmes" is Michael Phillips' Chicago Film Fest pick of the day. 
Discovered last year in a Cinematheque Francaise storage facility outside Paris, this is a Chicago-made artifact from cinema's "Lost and Found" department. In 1916, near the end of its heyday in the silent era, Essanay Studios commissioned a photoplay of William Gilletteâ€™s great stage success. In his only film performance, Gillette's sly, naturalistic portrayal of the Arthur Conan Doyle sleuth comes through without a speck of Victorian theatrics. The film itself is no classic, but for Holmes aficionados and particularly for Chicagoans it's a fascinating time capsule. Each time the action moves outside, to a brick-paved alley or country scene, you play a guessing game in your own mind: Where'd they film that? 
3 p.m. Saturday, AMC River East 21, 322 E. Illinois St. Tickets $11-$14 at chicagofilmfestival.com . Running time: 1:56. 
-Michael Phillips
